SLogo.FunctionEvaluate.Functions

Interface Loop

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Invokable
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Loop
extends Invokable
    This interface provides a base implementation for loop control commands

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface SLogo.FunctionEvaluate.Functions.Invokable

        Invokable.UnexpectedArgumentException

      Loops while conditions are met

      • Methods inherited from interface SLogo.FunctionEvaluate.Functions.Invokable

        invoke, readArgs

    • Method Detail

      • getLoopParams

        java.lang.Object[] getLoopParams(Repl repl,
                                 Environment env,
                                 Expression loopParams)
        Determines {Variable name, initial value, bound, expression to be evaluated each iteration} from the first argument of this command
        Parameters:
        repl - Current REPL session
        env - Current environment
        loopParams - The loop parameters as an list expression, containing 1-4 elements
        Returns:
        An object array containing {Variable name, initial value, bound, expression to be evaluated and used to increment loop}

      • minimumArity

        default int minimumArity()
        Specified by:
        minimumArity in interface Invokable
        Returns:
        Minimum number of arguments in this Invokable

      • eval

        default Variable eval(Repl repl,
                      Environment env,
                      Expression... exprs)
        Sets up initial parameters for the loop, and starts it
        Specified by:
        eval in interface Invokable
        Parameters:
        repl - Current REPL session
        env - Current dynamic runtime environment
        exprs - Array of arguments to this command
        Returns:
        Result of final iteration of the loop as a List

      • operation

        default Variable operation(Repl repl,
                           Environment env,
                           Variable last,
                           java.lang.String loopVar,
                           java.util.function.Predicate<Variable> condition,
                           Expression onChange,
                           Expression... exprs)
        Loops while conditions are met
        Parameters:
        repl - Current REPL session
        env - Current Environment
        last - Value of previous iteration of the loop
        loopVar - Name of loop variable
        condition - Condition to be checked on each iteration of the loop
        onChange - Expression to be evaluated on each iteration of the loop, and used to increment loop variable
        exprs - Expressions to be evaluated on each iteration of the loop
        Returns:
        Result of final iteration of the loop as a List
